definition: lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
dust/dirt/earth
do not/there is none who
surname Mo
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: The transaction processing piece, meanwhile, has almost always had to play catch-up.
sentences.chinese: 而交易处理部门几乎总是跟在后面望尘莫及。

sentences.english: Mardy says Roddick's career will sit on his 15 times over .
sentences.chinese: 马迪说罗迪克的职业赛生涯仍然让他望尘莫及。

sentences.english: I am still hoping for a dictionary that will leave Google in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然希望有一部可以令谷歌望尘莫及的好词典。

sentences.english: China may just leave them in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 中国会迎头而上而你们只能在后面望尘莫及。

sentences.english: In short, strange, magic in general are far behind.
sentences.chinese: 总之，千奇百怪，一般魔幻都望尘莫及。

sentences.english: Haagen-Dazs ice cream had its competitors licked.
sentences.chinese: 哈根达斯冰淇淋让竞争对手望尘莫及。

sentences.english: South Africans chug down over 50 litres.
sentences.chinese: 南非则超过了50公升，令人望尘莫及。

definition: to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
not inferior in any respect
lit. to gaze at the ocean and lament one's inadequacy (idiom)/fig. to feel powerless and incompetent (to perform a task)
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
to blush with shame (literary)
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
nobody can compete with/unmatched by anybody/without rival
to exclaim in astonishment
to shrink back/to flinch
matchless/without equal/there is nothing better
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
most outstanding/par excellence
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
